intro: Maihuenia albolanata, commonly known as the Andean snowgrass, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, commonly known as grasses, and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white to pale pink florets in dense clusters. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Due to its ecological significance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
